commits.message: refactor(Style): fuse drawStylefromContext() and symbolStylefromContext() into applyContext()
refactor(Style): fuse drawStylefromContext() and symbolStylefromContext() into applyContext()

pull_request.title: Fusion get style
pull_request.body:
This PR aims at merging 2 Style methode that do basicaly the same but on different properties of Style:
- drawingStylefromContext()
- symbolStylefromContext()
into a unique function getStyleFromContext() 


A cleanup of the JSDoc of file Style.js has also been conducted.

commits.message:
feat(View): add getters for threejs renderer and camera

Use `View.renderer` to get the threejs renderer of the view
Use `View.camera3D` to get the threejs camera of the view

pull_request.title: Add View helpers
pull_request.body: Add some helper functions in `View` to get threejs renderer, renderer size and camera to avoid having to know itowns internal structure to access them.

pull_request.title: Fetching of Style.pattern images
pull_request.body:
Modification of style.pattern image fetching:

Based on the icon image fetching, we propose a similar approch for the style.pattern image fetching
This allow Style constructor to be cleaner.

repo.name: itowns
repo.description: A Three.js-based framework written in Javascript/WebGL for visualizing 3D geospatial data

pull_request.title: 3D Tiles fixes and perf improvements
pull_request.body:
Some 3D tiles fixes:
* Fix a bug that impacted display of 3D tiles with sphere bounding volumes, closes #1859
* Fix display of 3D Tiles bounding volumes of type sphere, closes #1888 and #1853

Perf improvement:
* Improve perfs for 3D tiles with bounding region by converting bounding regions to bounding spheres. Previously, bounding regions where converted to [OBB](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/blob/master/src/Renderer/OBB.js) and the AABB englobing the OBB was used for culling and SSE computation. Now, they are converted to bounding spheres and the sphere is used for culling and SSE computation. Depending on the cases it can be a bigger approximation than before but it is faster and I didn't see any visual discrepencies. I tested the perf differences on a 3D Tiles photogrammetry tileset (~500Go, 13732 tiles with only bounding regions) that I cannot share unfortunately. On the master, we spend most of our time initializing the bounding region:

![before-PR-0](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/22d47188-0ce5-4702-81e1-dd8915308c7f)

![before-PR-1](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/b72cd549-51b1-4c7f-9821-d84d06d777cd)

After the PR, we spend most of the time in parsing and preparing for rendering:

![after-PR-0](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/ea797dea-d69a-4c9a-a06c-e7a6a1071a52)
![after-PR-1](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/14f9d45e-d6e8-484a-bd42-79212e4acb9d)

I also tried to implement a conversion to [threejs' OBB](https://threejs.org/docs/index.html?q=obb#examples/en/math/OBB) and to implement a culling algorithm on OBB (SSE computation for OBB is easy) but didn't succeed completely (can be seen on [the following branch](https://github.com/jailln/itowns/tree/fix/GEO-18291-3dtiles-mel-history-save)). Another way would have been to [improve OBB.setFromExtent](https://github.com/jailln/itowns/blob/fix/GEO-18291-3dtiles-mel-history-save/src/Renderer/OBB.js#L106) which is the culprit but I haven't found another way of implementing it yet. Propositions are welcome :)

BREAKING CHANGE: Remove region, box and sphere properties of C3DTBoundingVolume. They have been replaced by volume property which contains a THREE.Box3 (for box) or a THREE.Sphere (for sphere or region). Initial bounding volume type can be retrieved with the initialVolumeType property.

repo.name: itowns
repo.description: A Three.js-based framework written in Javascript/WebGL for visualizing 3D geospatial data

repo.name: itowns

issue.title: [3D Tiles] Add viewer request volume support for box and region
issue.body: Currently, only 3D Tiles viewer request volumes of type sphere [are supported](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/blob/master/src/Core/3DTiles/C3DTBoundingVolume.js#L100). We could add support for box and region based on the support we already have for bounding volumes.

comment.body: In my opinion it is better to display what we use to perform the culling (i.e. bounding spheres now)

After the PR, we spend most of the time in parsing and preparing for rendering:

![after-PR-0](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/ea797dea-d69a-4c9a-a06c-e7a6a1071a52)
![after-PR-1](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/14f9d45e-d6e8-484a-bd42-79212e4acb9d)

I also tried to implement a conversion to [threejs' OBB](https://threejs.org/docs/index.html?q=obb#examples/en/math/OBB) and to implement a culling algorithm on OBB (SSE computation for OBB is easy) but didn't succeed completely (can be seen on [the following branch](https://github.com/jailln/itowns/tree/fix/GEO-18291-3dtiles-mel-history-save)). Another way would have been to [improve OBB.setFromExtent](https://github.com/jailln/itowns/blob/fix/GEO-18291-3dtiles-mel-history-save/src/Renderer/OBB.js#L106) which is the culprit but I haven't found another way of implementing it yet. Propositions are welcome :)

BREAKING CHANGE: Remove region, box and sphere properties of C3DTBoundingVolume. They have been replaced by volume property which contains a THREE.Box3 (for box) or a THREE.Sphere (for sphere or region). Initial bounding volume type can be retrieved with the initialVolumeType property.

repo.description: A Three.js-based framework written in Javascript/WebGL for visualizing 3D geospatial data

repo.name: itowns
repo.description: A Three.js-based framework written in Javascript/WebGL for visualizing 3D geospatial data

pull_request.title: 3D Tiles fixes and perf improvements
pull_request.body:
Some 3D tiles fixes:
* Fix a bug that impacted display of 3D tiles with sphere bounding volumes, closes #1859
* Fix display of 3D Tiles bounding volumes of type sphere, closes #1888 and #1853

Perf improvement:
* Improve perfs for 3D tiles with bounding region by converting bounding regions to bounding spheres. Previously, bounding regions where converted to [OBB](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/blob/master/src/Renderer/OBB.js) and the AABB englobing the OBB was used for culling and SSE computation. Now, they are converted to bounding spheres and the sphere is used for culling and SSE computation. Depending on the cases it can be a bigger approximation than before but it is faster and I didn't see any visual discrepencies. I tested the perf differences on a 3D Tiles photogrammetry tileset (~500Go, 13732 tiles with only bounding regions) that I cannot share unfortunately. On the master, we spend most of our time initializing the bounding region:

![before-PR-0](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/22d47188-0ce5-4702-81e1-dd8915308c7f)

![before-PR-1](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/b72cd549-51b1-4c7f-9821-d84d06d777cd)

After the PR, we spend most of the time in parsing and preparing for rendering:

![after-PR-0](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/ea797dea-d69a-4c9a-a06c-e7a6a1071a52)
![after-PR-1](https://github.com/iTowns/itowns/assets/16967916/14f9d45e-d6e8-484a-bd42-79212e4acb9d)

I also tried to implement a conversion to [threejs' OBB](https://threejs.org/docs/index.html?q=obb#examples/en/math/OBB) and to implement a culling algorithm on OBB (SSE computation for OBB is easy) but didn't succeed completely (can be seen on [the following branch](https://github.com/jailln/itowns/tree/fix/GEO-18291-3dtiles-mel-history-save)). Another way would have been to [improve OBB.setFromExtent](https://github.com/jailln/itowns/blob/fix/GEO-18291-3dtiles-mel-history-save/src/Renderer/OBB.js#L106) which is the culprit but I haven't found another way of implementing it yet. Propositions are welcome :)

BREAKING CHANGE: Remove region, box and sphere properties of C3DTBoundingVolume. They have been replaced by volume property which contains a THREE.Box3 (for box) or a THREE.Sphere (for sphere or region). Initial bounding volume type can be retrieved with the initialVolumeType property.

comment.body:
this was the cause of #1853 and #1888 : the same `Vector3` instance was used for all spehres bounding boxes and the center is not cloned in [Sphere constructor](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/src/math/Sphere.js#L12).
For box it's ok to use the same `boxCenter` and `boxSize` instance since they are used in `setFromCenterAndSize` which are not stored directly in the box.

pull_request.title: Fetching of Style.pattern images
pull_request.body:
Modification of style.pattern image fetching:

Based on the icon image fetching, we propose a similar approch for the style.pattern image fetching
This allow Style constructor to be cleaner.
